Luckily they've hit upon a solution. They just need some brave adventurer to venture into the creature's lair and bring them back its head. We can't envisage any complications with such a routine matter, right?","difficulty":"Intermediate","kills":"[[Headless Beast]] (level-82)","name":"Getting Ahead","start":"Speak to [[Gordon]] on [[Gordon and Mary's farm|his farm]] south of the [[Farming Guild]].","length":"Short","items":"*[[Bear fur]], [[grey wolf fur]], or [[Fur]] (a [[Grizzly bear]] and [[bear cub]] spawn west of the farm and two [[black bear]]s spawn east of the farm) *[[Soft clay]] or a [[pickaxe]] you can use ** [[Clay rocks]] are found in the [[Kebos Lowlands mine]] passed during the quest; ** Gordon's house has a water source and a bucket spawn; ** There is a [[Bronze pickaxe]] spawn at the mine, stuck in some rocks. *[[Hammer]] (obtainable near the cattle gate) *[[Saw]] (obtainable in the shed north of the house) *2 normal [[plank]]s (obtainable near the cave entrance) *At least 6 [[nails]] of any kind (iron nails can be found in the workbench north of the house, and more than 6 is recommended in case you bend a few) *[[Knife]] (obtainable on the kitchen table in the house) *[[Red dye]] (obtainable from the [[Shelves (Getting Ahead)|shelves]] in the house) *[[Pot of flour]] (obtainable upstairs in the house) *[[Needle]] (obtainable upstairs in the house) *[[Thread]] (obtainable upstairs in the house)"}

{"requirements":"* [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 12 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Firemaking icon.png|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 16 [[Firemaking]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Magic icon.png|link=Magic|alt=Magic]] 33 [[Magic]] (boostable) (not required to start) * [[File:Thieving icon.png|link=Thieving|alt=Thieving]] 14 [[Thieving]] (boostable) (not required to start)","desc":"Five hundred years have passed since the rule of King Alvis, saviour of Keldagrim and victim of his own inventions. He founded the Consortium: the gathering of Mining companies that were to serve the monarchy. But, eventually, the monarchy came to serve the Consortium. By the time of his death, the monarchy was all but abolished. Now the Kings in Keldagrim are but a distant memory... with only the statue of King Alvis to remind the people of the old days, the dark days. So begins the Rise of the Red Axe, the new multi-part storyline centred around the dwarves and their capital of Keldagrim. The first quest, The Giant Dwarf, introduces the city and the powerful business Consortium that rules the dwarven realm. Discover weird goings-on, narrowly escape from falling chunks of rock, ride around in minecarts and... make sure you don't bump into the wrong person on the way to the city!","difficulty":"Intermediate","kills":"None","name":"The Giant Dwarf","start":"The [[Keldagrim]] mines east of [[Rellekka]] and north of the [[Mountain Camp]]. Follow the dwarven statues to the underground river.","length":"Medium","items":"* 200 [[coins]] for the clothes * Means to cast [[Telekinetic Grab]] ([[air rune|air]] and [[law rune]]) * [[Logs]] (most logs will work, however, arctic pine, redwood & coloured logs do not work) * [[Tinderbox]] * [[Coal]] (obtainable during the quest with 30 [[Mining]]) * [[Iron bar]] * 3 cut [[sapphire]]s * Various [[ores]] and [[bar]]s (mostly obtainable during the quest, see below) * [[Redberry pie]] (unless you have previously given [[Thurgo]] a pie for free—outside the [[The Knight's Sword]] quest)"}

{"requirements":"* [[File:Agility icon.png|link=Agility|alt=Agility]] 25 [[Agility]] (boostable) (not required to start)\n* The ability to defeat a level 172 [[Black demon (The Grand Tree)|Black demon]] (safespottable for Ranged and Magic or melee using a [[halberd]]).","desc":"The [[Grand Tree]], which shelters the majority of the small gnome population of ''RuneScape'', is dying. {"requirements":"* Completion of the following quests: ** [[Priest in Peril]] * [[File:Crafting icon.png|link=Crafting|alt=Crafting]] 35 [[Crafting]] (boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to defeat a level 95 enemy * Access to [[Abandoned Mine]]","desc":"Recent forays into Morytania by some of Saradomin's more fanatical supporters have unearthed murky rumours concerning an abandoned mine in the south. {"requirements":"None - but a high [[combat level]] is recommended.","desc":"Assist [[Brother Aimeri]] in uncovering the mysteries that lie in the [[Forthos Dungeon]].","difficulty":"Experienced","kills":"Varies","name":"In Search of Knowledge","start":"[[Brother Aimeri]], towards the south-eastern end of the [[Forthos Dungeon]].","length":"Medium","items":"* [[Combat equipment]]\n* 5 pieces of food (must be meat, fish or vegetables)\n* A [[slash weapon]] or [[knife]] to cut through webs"}

{"requirements":"* Completion of [[Beneath Cursed Sands]]","desc":"Long ago, the people of the Kharidian Desert lived prosperous, luxurious lives, under the watchful eyes of their beloved gods.

All that changed when Amascut, the Goddess of Rebirth, became corrupted. She was reborn as The Devourer, intent on consuming every living soul in existence.

Deep within the desert, an ancient tomb has long hidden a great power – and The Devourer is determined to harness it at any cost.

If she succeeds, all hope is lost. You must traverse the tomb's many obstacles and foil her evil plans... before it's too late.","difficulty":"Master","kills":"* '''Note:''' This section assumes the raid level is 0 (no invocations).
* [[Akkha]] (level 337)
* [[Ba-Ba]] (level 359)
* [[Kephri]] (level 341)
* [[Zebak]] (level 371)
* [[Tumeken's Warden]] (level 489)
* [[Elidinis' Warden]] (level 489)","name":"Into the Tombs","start":"Talk to [[Maisa]] inside [[Jaltevas Pyramid|Osmumten's tomb]] at the [[Necropolis]].","length":"Medium","items":""}

{"requirements":"* Completion of [[Druidic Ritual]]\n* [[File:Herblore icon.png|link=Herblore|alt=Herblore]] 3 [[Herblore]] (boostable) (not required to start)\n* The ability to defend against level 53 [[Jogre]]s and level 46 [[Harpie Bug Swarm]]s.","desc":"[[Trufitus Shakaya]] of the [[Tai Bwo Wannai Village]] requires that you collect five special jungle herbs for a potion so he can commune with his Gods.","difficulty":"Novice","kills":"None","name":"Jungle Potion","start":"Speak to [[Trufitus]] at [[Tai Bwo Wannai]].","length":"Short","items":""}

{"requirements":"* [[File:Mining icon.png|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 10 [[Mining]] (boostable) (not required to start) * The ability to run from [[combat level|level]] 57 [[ice warrior]]s and level 53 [[ice giant]]s could help.","desc":"Sir Vyvin's squire is in trouble. For [[Members]] accounts that wish to avoid combat entirely, there is an iron bar that spawns inside [[Thurid's Brain Buckets]]. This requires completion of the [[Children of the Sun]] quest in order to gain access to [[Varlamore]].","items":"* [[Redberry pie]] (not [[half a redberry pie]]), (Members can purchase one from [[Romily Weaklax]] in the [[Cooks' Guild]]) * 2 [[iron bar]]s (4 if you want your own [[blurite sword]]) (one spawns west of the [[Graveyard of Shadows]] in the [[Wilderness]]) * [[Blurite ore]] (2 if you want your own blurite sword; it is obtained/obtainable during the quest) (If you plan on doing Falador easy diary AND making a second sword, mine a third blurite ore [members only]) ** Any [[pickaxe]] (one spawns in south Falador)"}

{"requirements":"*[[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 40 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (unknown[[Category:Unknown start requirement status]])\n*The [[Haunted Mine]] quest is required to access [[Tarn's Lair]].","desc":"This miniquest is to kill [[Tarn Razorlor]] and retrieve his diary. {"requirements":"* [[File:Slayer icon.png|link=Slayer|alt=Slayer]] 48 [[Slayer]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Hunter icon.png|link=Hunter|alt=Hunter]] 20 [[Hunter]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Fishing icon.png|link=Fishing|alt=Fishing]] 20 [[Fishing]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Runecraft icon.png|link=Runecraft|alt=Runecraft]] 20 [[Runecraft]] (not boostable) (required to start) * [[File:Construction icon.png|link=Construction|alt=Construction]] 10 [[Construction]] (not boostable) (required to start) *Completion of the following quests: ** [[Twilight's Promise]] *** [[Children of the Sun]]","desc":"Beneath the steep and jagged cliffs of Ralos' Rise sits the dwarven town of Cam Torum. Now, the earth has been disturbed – and the dwarves need your help to keep these strange beings contained!","difficulty":"Master","kills":"* [[Sulphur Nagua (Perilous Moons)|Sulphur Nagua]] (level 98) * [[Blue Moon]] (level 329) * [[Blood Moon]] (level 329) * [[Eclipse Moon]] (level 329)","name":"Perilous Moons","start":"Speak to [[Zuma]] or [[Attala]] at the entrance to [[Cam Torum]].","length":"Medium","items":"* [[Knife]] (obtainable during quest) * [[Big fishing net]] (obtainable during quest) * [[Rope]] (obtainable during quest) * [[Pestle and mortar]] (obtainable during quest) * Combat equipment for multiple [[PvM]] encounters."}

{"requirements":"Able to defeat or run away from a [[Combat level]] 4 [[gardener]].","desc":"Redbeard Frank knows the location of pirate treasure, but he'll only part with the knowledge for a bottle of [[Karamjan rum]].","difficulty":"Novice","kills":"[[Gardener]] ''(level 4, optional)''","name":"Pirate's Treasure","start":"Speak to [[Redbeard Frank]] at the northernmost dock at [[Port Sarim]], just outside [[The Rusty Anchor]].","length":"Very Short","items":"*[[Karamjan rum]] (obtainable during the quest for 30 coins)

*[[Spade]] (obtainable during the quest)"}

{"requirements":"None","desc":"Ah, the Falador Farm - filled with cabbages, cows, and even a sleepy sheepdog. A peaceful place, where you can learn to churn butter, give a dog a bone, or purchase various Farming supplies. What was once a place of happiness, joy and wholesome dairy goods has of late become dominated by a vile presence. Each morning Sarah wakes to find her crops destroyed, her cows cowering, and her loyal sheepdog looking... sheepish.

\nShe's had enough, but she thinks she's got the culprit on the trot. Can you help her track down... A Porcine of Interest?","difficulty":"Novice","kills":"[[Sourhog]] (level 37)","name":"A Porcine of Interest","start":"Read the town [[Notice board (Draynor Village)|notice board]] in [[Draynor Village]], behind [[Fortunato]]'s [[Wine Shop]].","length":"Very Short","items":"* [[Rope]]\n* [[Knife]] or a [[slash weapon]] (except [[abyssal whip]], [[abyssal tentacle]], or [[dragon claws]]) (obtainable during the quest)"}

{"requirements":"None","desc":"Recently contact has been lost with the temple to Saradomin on Misthalins' Eastern border. All 50 essence does not have to be of the same type.)\n* [[Bucket]] (spawns above the Varrock Castle's kitchen in the north-easternmost room (go to the kitchen, and climb up the stairs))"}
